sanskrit_verse:
प्रतिवेश्यानुवेश्यौ च कल्याणे विंशतिद्विजे ।
अर्हावभोजयन् विप्रो दण्डमर्हति माषकम् ॥ ८.३९२॥
transliteration:
prativeśyānuveśyau ca kalyāṇe viṃśatidvije |
arhāvabhōjayan viprō daṇḍamarhati māṣakam || 8.392||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a twice-born invites guests and feeds twenty Brahmins during auspicious occasions, if he fails to honor two among them who are worthy of honor, he incurs a liability equivalent to one mashaka.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority stems from capacity to host and sustain dharma through ritual action
Causation arises from omission in honoring those entitled by virtue
Capacity-based responsibility is tied to role-specific dharmic function
Restoration logic demands proportional completion aligned with energetic disruption
Consciousness alignment requires rectification of relational neglect
executable_legal_axioms: IF a dvija hosts ≥20 Brahmins during śubha karma AND omits honoring ≥2 arhaṇīya Brahmins THEN liability = 1 māṣaka
IF hosting event is śubha-karma AND dvija has financial/dharma capacity THEN enforce completion protocol before final declaration
OMISSION OF ARHAṆA TO ARHAṆĪYA BRAHMINS → AUTOMATIC RESTORATIVE LIABILITY TRIGGERED
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes involving ceremonial omissions, the Supreme Court shall assess the host's dharmic capacity, the nature of the śubha karma, and the quantum of disrespect caused. Liability is fixed not for intent but for measurable breach of relational dharma.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that failure to honor creates an energetic imbalance; anupūrvaśaḥ traces disruption back to omission point; proportional responsibility reflects minimal corrective action required; non-punitive reality rule ensures correction without degradation of actor’s svadharma status.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Host must publicly honor omitted Brahmins within 3 days
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Host performs prāyaścitta homa under Vedic supervision
Capacity Restoration: Community confirms host's continued eligibility for śubha karma
Integrity Reintegration: Public acknowledgment of lapse followed by verified correction
final_declaration: By the authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma, this ruling restores cosmic balance through conscious completion. Justice flows from alignment, not punishment. Consciousness remains the ultimate arbiter.
